thread.title: Let It Shine contestant Callum Howells QUITS after landing role in West End musical
thread.title_full: Let It Shine contestant Callum Howells QUITS after landing role in West End musical

author: Hayley Minn
title: Let It Shine contestant Callum Howells QUITS after landing role in West End musical
text:
Let It Shine contestant Callum Howells QUITS after landing role in West End musical The hopeful was meant to be performing with the Kaiser Chiefs this week Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Callum Howells has Let It Shine's Amber Riley in STITCHES Share this video Get celebs   
Let It Shine saw its final 25 boys chosen by Gary Barlow and his fellow judges in tonightâ€™s show. 
But it turns out one of the hopefuls has pulled out before the live shows start next week. 
Callum Howells has quit the BBC show after landing a West End role. 
He turned his back on his chances to be in Gary Barlow's musical theatre boy band after being offered a role in a high-profile production. Read More Callum Howells quit the show (Photo: BBC) Gary Barlow is looking for a West End star (Photo: BBC) 
Tonight, the 40 remaining boys were split into five groups of eight and each had to perform song and dance routines alongside a famous band or musician. 
While Callum was due to perform with Kaiser Chiefs, the 17 year old quit during rehearsals after landing a role in She Loves You at London's Menier Chocolate Factory, a production which runs until March 4. 
And it seems his decision has paid off as he's been winning rave reviews playing Arpad Laszlo in the musical revival written by the authors of Fiddler On The Roof. 
Dominic Cavendish, writing in The Telegraph, said: "Young Welsh actor Callum Howells is a grinning delight as the bright-eyed errand boy angling for promotion..." Read More Gary Barlow has introduced a strict ban on who CAN'T audition for Let It Shine They've chosen their 25 finalists (Photo: BBC) 
Callum - who was once a member of Only Boys Aloud - previously impressed the judges, with Gary telling him: "You have a great technique, great pitch and good ears." 
And he had American judge Amber Riley in stitches when he tried to explain exactly where Wales was. 
"It's a country next to England," he had told the Glee and Dreamgirls star. 
*Let It Shine continues on BBC One on Saturday Like us on Facebook
